title: Man and woman arrested after baby found dead at home in Huddersfield
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A man and a woman have been arrested after a baby died at a house in Huddersfield.

Police and paramedics were called to the address in Mill Avenue shortly before 7am and found the four-month-old not breathing.

The baby was rushed to hospital where it was confirmed to have died.

West Yorkshire Police said a man, aged 44, and a woman, aged 31, have been arrested in connection with the death.

Both have now been bailed while investigations continue.

A full police statement, released today, read: "Emergency services were called at 6.44am on Sunday to an address in the Dalton area of Huddersfield to a report of a 4-month-old baby not breathing.

(Image: MEN Media)

"Paramedics and police attended the address and the baby was taken to hospital where sadly it was confirmed the baby had died.

"Police arrested a 31-year-old female and a 44-year-old male in connection with the child’s death. Both have now been bailed pending continuing enquiries.

"A post-mortem examination will take place this week to determine the cause of death.

"Detectives are continuing enquiries to determine the exact circumstances of the death."

Residents of Mill Avenue woke up on Sunday morning to the sight of police forensics vehicles parked outside the house.

(Image: MEN Media)

One woman said investigators spent all day inside the house.

She said: "The police forensics have been here all day taking photos. I’ve seen them flashing inside the house.”

The resident, who did not know what had happened at the time, went on to describe Mill Avenue as a "usually quiet" street.
description: The man, 44 and woman, 31, have been bailed while investigations continue following the incident in Dalton
